metadata.title: CVE-2023-0597 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw possibility of memory leak in the Linux kernel cpu_entry_areamapping of X86 CPU data to memory was found in the way user can guesslocation of exception stack(s) or other important data. A local user coulduse this flaw to get access to some important data with expected locationin memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0597` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-lowlatency - 4.15.0-219.230~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-aws - 4.15.0-1162.175~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1171-azure - 4.15.0-1171.186~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1156-gcp - 4.15.0-1156.173~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1125-oracle - 4.15.0-1125.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-219.230~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').

linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.175~16.04.1').

linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1156.173~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
